headline: Honey Cornbread
description: This honey cornbread made with heavy cream is simple to make and has a lovely sweet flavor and tender crumb that's perfect with a bowl of hot chili.

video.description: This melt-in-your-mouth cornbread has a hint of sweetness!
video.name: Honey Cornbread

name: Honey Cornbread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.

Stir together flour, cornmeal, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl; form a well in the center. Add cream, eggs, oil, and honey; stir until well combined. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved the recipe! It was a little crumbly and dry so I added an egg yolk and used buttermilk instead. And it was perfect üëçüèª
Perfect
I didn‚Äôt like it. I‚Äôll try another recipe.

Great cornbread recipe. I made it exactly to the directions and it was very good. As others have said, it could use a pinch of salt. I'm making it again and added the salt and also have a can of corn, drained. I'm expecting great results. I do mine in a cast iron skillet and use ghee to coat the skillet.
Once I found this recipe it is my one and only. However, I reduced the baking powder to a little less than 1/2 tablespoon because it was too crumbly otherwise.
Great recipe. Follow recipe and don't over bake. Awesome when just out of oven with a pad of Irish Gold butter.

I loved this recipe. I was out of heavy cream so, i used whole milk and the recipe came out moist and delicious. Anytime you add a sweetener to a recipe you will need to cover the dish to avoid burning. I prepared a double recipe. Both were cooked in a glass Pyrex dish. The first one I did not cover until it had already browned. This one came out very dark. The second one I covered until the last 10 minutes of baking and it came out golden brown.

This flavor was good. I did have to substitute ingredients because I didn't have everything. I used melted margarine for the oil and milk with melted butter (as I read from another review) for heavy cream. This was my first time making cornbread from scratch. I am proud of how it turned out. I will be adding this to my recipes.

Very nice cornbread. Easily browns so I had to cover after 10 minutes with foil. I also had to slice off dark brown burned looking ends . Otherwise it was moist and tender. But I like some of my other cornbreads made with buttermilk a bit better.

I loved the base of this recipe. The only thing I would change for the future is to add some more honey but that is just personal preference. I did have to cook it longer than the recipe called for but I think that's cause I used a pan that wasn't to the exact measurements. I think I used an 8x10 or something like that.
This is excellent sweet cornbread. I didn‚Äôt have heavy cream so I thinned out some sour cream with milk and it worked just fine. I will absolutely make this again.
This was good, but my family felt it needed a little salt. The only change I made was substituting 2T of butter and up to 1c 1% milk for heavy cream.
This is my go to when making Chili and cornbread
Made this with my minis. Came out great. I added an extra 1/4 c of cornmeal to the batter.
Wow, best tasting cornbread to date! Didn‚Äôt have any cream so I substituted 3/4 cup milk, 1/3 cup melted butter and it worked. So good!
A nice sweet cornbread. The reason for four stars is it's a bit on the crumbly side.
HUGE hit!! I will make this a lot for my guests.
This makes a great corn muffin. I used milk as I didn't have cream on hand. I plan to try it with cream next time. It was easy to cut the recipe in half for the portions I needed.

Really good base recipe. I replaced 1 cup buttermilk for the cream. I increased the oil to 1/3 cup and decreased baking powder to 1 tsp. It turned out moist and delicious. the honey created a lovely sweet floral taste.

I love everything about this recipe, from the flavor to the texture ...... it is so thick and light. 
I exchanged almond flour for the all-purpose flour and it turned out amazing!! My only problem is that I did not have enough honey, I used what I had and it still came out amazing!! It is a very easy recipe to make also.

This is the BEST cornbread I've ever made. My husband does not like it dry and I prefer it sweet. This masters both! It was awesome with goulash last nite. Highly recommend, worth getting cream in the house for!
This was perfect. Baked in a pre-heated and oiled cast iron skillet. Not too sweet.

The family loved it. My husband and father-in-law said it was addictive. Take a chance you will be delighted.
Susan
This recipe wasn‚Äôt as sweet or rich as I like. I may try butter instead of oil next time, though oil makes for a more moist cornbread. I‚Äôll definitely use this one again
I skipped the cream and used oat milk, and it was good!! Loved making it in a cast iron pan.

Fantastic recipe!!! I had to cook it a bit longer and put foil on top once it was browning too much to avoid burning. I will take the advice of many reviewers and add a bit of salt next time. The bread was moist and sweet and did not crumble apart when eating. Delicious!!!!
I followed this to the letter and it was really bad. It was sickly sweet and grainy, and yes, crumbly. Not good.
Really good. I added some chili‚Äôs for extra flavor
Too dry. They also crumbled into powder on the second day. I might try again and add an egg...idk. Not better than jiffy boxed corn bread mix.
I made it exactly to the recipe except I used half and half instead of heavy cream. My wife and I both agreed that this was the best cornbread we have ever made. Excellent recipe, thank you.
We love this sweet cornbread...In a hurry and used 2 boxes Jiffy cornbread. Reduced white sugar by 1/2...It's a family favorite...
Due to gluten intolerance I used gluten free, 1 for 1 "flour". Takes longer to cook, but is delicious. Butter is all we use on this treat.
Delicious cornbread. Moist and spongy,
My husband loved this recipe! I didn't make any changes and it came out delicious!
So good and a breeze to make. Everyone at the table gave this 5 stars. Warm with butter, you can't beat it. I'm keeping this recipe!
Sweet and buttery. This works great and is very easy. We have added it to my son's limited recipe list and he is proud of the results!
This is a great recipe, I didn¬¥t have honey, but still works perfectly every time. Love it!
I added 1/2 t salt, 1/2 can whole corn, and 1 t chopped jalapeno. I made it in a greased cast iron skillet, that I preheated. Yum!
amazing can't wait to make it again

Loved the recipe
Added a caramel glaze and chocolate chips
Love, Love, Love this recpie. I love a nice cornbread and this one surely didn't miss the mark. Would pair well with nice jambalaya, chili or even a nice goulash.
The best that I have ever made (and I have made numerous recipes)!
So good! Definitely a huge hit. The only change I made was adding a honey butter to the top of the warm cornbread.
Very easy recipe to follow, the cornbread turned out great, thank you

not fan of cooking this was first cake to ever make solo, I was short on cream so I substituted it with milk and butter also the measures of the recipe wasn't perfect but at the end the cake was really good but instead of honey on top i added nutella (:
Too dry. Does crumble when you touch it as stated. Taste bad.
This recipe was requested by my husband, i‚ÄòVe been using coconut oil on my baking instead of vegetable oil and it turned out great. I baked it on cast iron pan and it worked well. It was delicious,

Unquestionably the very best cornbread I've ever made. The only change I made was to use milk mixed with melted butter instead of heavy cream (because I had no cream). Still, perfect cornbread. Perfect.

The recipe instructions said to "pour" the completed mixture into the baking pan, pouring was not possible as the mixture was thicker than mortar mix. After baking and tasting, we threw it away,,total disappointment .
It was very good. not too sweet, just right. Easy to make
It was really good
Horrible! Complete lack of flavor. I added salt to bring out the honey taste & neither shined through. I'll print this just to make sure I don't accidentally do a recipe search & make it again.

Made this to the T. 
The only thing missing, in my opinion, is salt.
Other than that, It went great with my butter beans today.

This was excellent! My daughter is very picky about her cornbread, and this is the one she says is closest to her grandma's, and we all love it! I had to substitute 3/4 c. milk and 1/3 c. melted butter for the heavy cream like another reviewer had said, since I didn't have any either-- but it came out great! Used my 8x8 pan & baked for 27 minutes-- perfection. Thank you so much for this recipe! We will enjoy it often!
Love this recipe and have made it like 10x now. Most recent time I chopped up some jalape√±o and added it in, they were a bit more crumbly than usual but still tasty.
Needs a touch of salt. Other than that, delicious.

Delicious! Not too crumbly, perfectly browned after 25 minutes at 375 degrees.
I halved the sugar but next time will omit as I think the honey is enough sweetness.
No cream so I took the advice of another reviewer and substituted 3/4 cup skim and 1/4 cup melted butter.
Had this cornbread with Black Bean and Salsa soup on this site.
Loved it so tasty.

Delicious!!!! I didn't have cream so i used what i had on hand. instead of the cream I did 1/2 cup of oat milk, 1/4 cup of nut pods non-dairy creamer, and 1/4 cup of melted butter. Best corn bread I've tried. perfectly firm and just crumbly enough without it getting everywhere. It melts in your mouth and is great with honey butter or herb butter. I can't wait to make this again. So easy to prepare!
This cornbread was so yummy and not as crumbly as most cornbread recipes turnover

I made it into muffins, this recipe yielded 18 small muffins that didn‚Äôt overflow. I baked them for 16 minutes. Although they were moist, not enough flavor, so next time I‚Äôll add agave nectar and see. I also substituted the heavy cream because I didn‚Äôt have any, I used 3/4 c milk lactose and 1/4 c butter. Best recipe yet regardless of sweetness.
One of the best cornbreads I've had!

Made this exactly like the recipe. It had an unusual texture and after taste. It was light but then really gritty afterward. Hard to describe. I also made Grandmother's Buttermilk Cornbread. Hands down the winner between these two recipes.
I've been looking for a cornbread recipe and this one is perfect.
Most and amazing flavor!! Found my new favorite recipe.
good! But NOT exceptional.....the buttermilk recipe is nicer and most definitely moister!!
So good! Perfection!!
Very nice cornbread. It wasn‚Äôt as crumbly as some are, and the honey added a nice touch.
This the only cornbread recipe I use can be made with whole milk if need to.
Great recipe. Followed exactly for a slightly sweet corn bread.
I love this recipe. So quick and easy yet delicious.
Perfect! Moist and sweet cornbread! I cooked it in a 8 x 11 glass pan and it came out great!

This was great. I added a half teaspoon of salt like many reviewers recommended and that worked well for me. Baked for 25 min. I used apricot syrup in place of the honey just to give it a try and it worked well, though not a distinctly different taste. Everyone loved it but just one person said it was too sweet. I will be using this again!!
Very good!

I added tsp of salt. 
This is now my go to cornbread. 
Loved it!
Good, but I thought the taste was a bit flat - just a bit of salt would help.
This was awful, mainly because the cornmeal obviously needed to be soaked to soften it prior to baking. As made, the cornbread went straight into the garbage. Hard cornmeal on the teeth=nasty.
I added an extra egg: makes it more cake-like.
I used olive oil and milk. really good
Delicious! I wanted to make this Gluten Free so used corn flour and corn meal. Also baked in an oiled and heated (in the oven) iron skillet. Very light and flavorful.

This is my favorite recipe for cornbread and I've made it several times now, usually with a crockpot of chili. I make it exactly as directed but sometimes I use 1/2&1/2 instead of heavy cream, depending on what I have on hand.
Needed a pinch of salt and cinnamon for balance. Nice texture!
Loved this recipe! Thanks for sharing with us all!! Next time I‚Äôll add jalape√±os simply because it sounds like perfection to me :)
Great. I followed one of the suggestions below and used 3/4 cup of milk and 1/3 cup of melted butter instead of the heavy cream. It turned out perfect and I have never liked cornbread.
The texture was ok, the flavor was severely lacking.

If you haven't already try making pancakes with this batter! 

This recipe is delicious. I made muffins. I baked for 15 minutes. probably less time was needed. I had a little extra batter after 12 regular sized muffins. I decided to make a pancake with that. Me and my 2 kids gobbled that one pancake immediately. Will make pancakes next time using this recipe. The only changes I made are using 1/2 tsp salt and since I don't have cream, I substituted with equal amount evaporated milk.

I made this as a meal prep for a quick breakfast before work, and it turned out pretty good. 5 stars for flavor, however, I did mess up a bit and I used bread pans instead of the 9x9 recommended and baked at a lower temp for longer. Ended up making it more crumbly, however, it was somehow still most? Anywho, turned out pretty good. I also substituted the honey with homemade honey butter to make it a little buttery as well. Flavor was spot on!
I found this to be very bland. I usually love cornbread but I stopped eating this after a couple bites. I expected it to be tasty given all the fat (cream) that is in it but it wasn't.
I think it needs some salt, other wise it's good, but not great. I thought it was the recipe I used before which I loved, but it's not.
I used coconut milk instead of regular and it came out pretty good.

I used coconut milk in place of milk
coconut oil in place of veggie oil
1 1/2 C (increased the corn flour) and only 1/2 c white flour
More honey less organic sugar

It came out wonderful!
Followed the recipe except for adding a pinch of kosher salt. I served it with a spicy honey sauce (just added sriracha) & a honey butter. It was fantastic!
Love this recipe! I doubled the recipe and also added baking soda
So sweet and tasty! The perfect addition to a hearty, spicy chili. Next time, I‚Äôm going to run the cornmeal through the food processor to get rid of the graininess.
Very good. I used whole milk instead of cream. I also added 1 large jalapeno, chopped into small pieces.
didn't have a cake tin handy so I used two loaf pans, still turned out great, otherwise made as per recipe
Followed the recipe and we thought it was too crumbly and a little dry.

Best cornbread ever! I did have to make a few changes because I didn't have heavy cream and am gluten free. I used 2/3 cup sour cream and 1 cup whole milk to replace the heavy cream. I used Bob's 1to1 Gluten Free AP Mix. The batter that didn't fit in my pan were cooked on a griddle like pancakes. So good Tim, thanks for sharing!
super moist! might cut back on the honey next time. definitely try it!
